content: <1>{{displayName}}</1> invites you to join the room <1>{{roomName}}</1> for secure document collaboration.

comment.text: This translation key is used for a notification message that invites a user to join a secure collaboration room. It appears in a greeting component when a new user joins or creates an account, and it includes placeholders for the user's display name and the room's title. The purpose of this text is to inform the user about the invitation to collaborate on documents securely.

usage.context:
<div className="tooltip">
 <Text fontSize="16px">
 {roomData.title ? (
 <Trans
 t={t}
 i18nKey="InvitationToRoom"
 ns="Common"
 defaults={DEFAULT_ROOM_TEXT}
 values={{
 displayName,
 ...(roomData.title

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'dəvət' (invite) is potentially incorrect. In this context, 'qonaq edir' (is inviting) might be more natural and convey the intended meaning better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{displayName}}</1> sizi təhlükəsiz sənəd əməkdaşlığı üçün <1>{{roomName}}</1> otağına qonaq edir.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While grammatically correct, the sentence structure feels slightly awkward. Consider rephrasing for smoother flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{displayName}}</1> təhlükəsiz sənəd əməkdaşlığı üçün <1>{{roomName}}</1> otağına qoşulmağınıza dəvət edir.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses 'le invita' which is a bit formal for this context. A more conversational and natural phrasing would be better. While grammatically correct, it doesn't perfectly match the tone of the English.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{displayName}}</1> te invita a unirte a la sala <1>{{roomName}}</1> para una colaboración segura en documentos.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'սենյակին' (senyakin) is in the dative case, implying movement *to* the room. However, the English indicates simply *joining* the room. A more appropriate case would be the locative or nominative.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider changing 'սենյակին' to 'սենյակում' (senyakum - in the room) or 'սենյակը' (senyak-e - the room) to better reflect the intended meaning.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'secure document collaboration' is translated as 'collaborazione sicura sui documenti'. While technically correct, a more natural and idiomatic Italian translation would be 'condivisione sicura di documenti' or 'collaborazione sicura per la condivisione di documenti'.

The phrase "安全なドキュメント共同作業をするように" is a literal translation of "for secure document collaboration" and sounds unnatural in Japanese. A more natural phrasing would be something like "安全なドキュメント共同作業のために" or "共同作業のため".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 安全なドキュメント共同作業のために

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The particle 'に' after ルーム is a bit awkward. While technically not incorrect, it's not the most natural way to express invitation to a room.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ルーム<1>{{roomName}}</1>に参加するように招待しています

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent with standard practices. While technically allowed, they aren't necessary and should be standardized or removed. Assuming standard HTML or Markdown is desired.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags altogether, or use standard HTML tags like <span> or <div> if formatting is necessary.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation uses "귀하를" which is very formal and sounds unnatural in this context. A more natural phrasing would be "당신을" or even omitting the explicit pronoun and simply saying "<1>{{roomName}}</1> 방에 초대했습니다." The original English is an invitation, and a formal '귀하를' is not aligned with that tone.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{displayName}}</1>님이 안전한 문서 공동작업을 위해 <1>{{roomName}}</1> 방에 초대했습니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation adds "님이" after the display name. While grammatically correct, it's slightly different from the English structure. It changes the flow and emphasis slightly. Consider aligning the formatting more closely to the English. This is a stylistic choice, not strictly an error.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{displayName}}</1> 가 안전한 문서 공동작업을 위해 <1>{{roomName}}</1> 방에 초대했습니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'secure' is not directly translated. While 'ຢ່າງປອດໄພ' (yang pod sai) conveys safety/security, a more literal translation might be more appropriate depending on the desired tone.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives for 'ຢ່າງປອດໄພ' like 'ຄວາມປອດໄພ' if a more direct translation is preferred.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ආරාධනා කර ඇත" (aaradanaa karaa geta) is a bit formal and doesn't perfectly capture the inviting tone. A more natural phrasing would be something along the lines of "අමමතායි" (ammantāyī) or "අයිති කරයි" (āyithī karai).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace "ආරාධනා කර ඇත" with "අමමතායි" or "අයිති කරයි".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure is slightly awkward.  It's a bit lengthy and could be broken down for better flow. While technically correct, it isn't the most elegant Sinhala.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider restructuring the sentence for better readability. For example, "<1>{{displayName}}</1> ඔබට <1>{{roomName}}</1> කාමරයට ඇමමතායි, එහිදී ඔබට සහයෝගයෙන් ලේඛන වල වැඩ කිරීමට හැකියාව ලැබේ." ({{displayName}} invites you to the room {{roomName}}, where you have the ability to collaborate on documents.)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'приступите' (pristupite) is not the most natural way to say 'join' in this context. 'Уђите' (udjite) or 'Улажите' (ulazite) would be more common and idiomatic for joining a room.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{displayName}}</1> вас позива да уђете/улазите соби <1>{{roomName}}</1> за сигурну документ сарадњу.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'pripasti' (to belong) would be more natural than 'pristupite' (to access/approach) in this context. While 'pristupite' isn't *incorrect*, it's not the most idiomatic choice for inviting someone to join a room.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{displayName}}</1> vas poziva da se pridružite sobi <1>{{roomName}}</1> za sigurnu dokument saradnju.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure 'Sizi katılmaya davet ediyor' is a bit awkward in Turkish. A more natural phrasing would be 'odasına katılmanız için davet ediyor' or 'katılmanız için davet ediyor'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Sizi odasına katılmanız için davet ediyor.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The space after the opening `<1>` tag is unnecessary and inconsistent with English content. It should be removed.
The space after the closing `<1>` tag is unnecessary and inconsistent with English content. It should be removed.

The phrase 'secure document collaboration' is translated as '安全地共同编辑处理文档'. While technically correct, '安全地共同编辑处理文档' is a bit verbose and awkward. A more natural and concise translation would be something like '安全协作文档' (anquan hezuo wenxian) or '共享安全文档' (gongxiang anquan wenxian).
